DataElement.preferredName: Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index Risk Assessment Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to estimate a patient's risk of mantle cell lymphoma progression or relapse and overall survival following therapy using a scoring system. It uses the criteria of patient's age, ECOG performance status, serum LDH activity, WBC count and Ki-67 index to classify patients into low risk, medium risk or high risk groups. The MIPIb score is calculated using the formula: [0.03535 x age (years)] + 0.6978 (if ECOG > 1) + [1.367 x log10(LDH/ULN)] + [0.9393 x log10(WBC count)] + [0.02142 x Ki-67 (%)]. A score < 5.7 indicates low risk disease, 5.7 - 6.5 indicates intermediate risk, and 6.5 or greater high risk.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index Risk Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A scoring system designed to classify a patient's risk of mantle cell lymphoma progression or relapse and overall survival following therapy. It uses the criteria of patient's age, ECOG performance status, serum LDH activity, WBC count and Ki-67 index to classify patients into low risk, medium risk or high risk groups. The MIPIb score is calculated using the formula: [0.03535 x age (years)] + 0.6978 (if ECOG > 1) + [1.367 x log10(LDH/ULN)] + [0.9393 x log10(WBC count)] + [0.02142 x Ki-67 (%)]. A score < 5.7 indicates low risk disease, 5.7 - 6.5 indicates intermediate risk, and 6.5 or greater high risk._An estimated probability that one or more adverse event(s) will occur as a result of exposure to an actual or potential hazardous situation or chemical.

It uses the criteria of patient's age, ECOG performance status, serum LDH activity, WBC count and Ki-67 index to classify patients into low risk, medium risk or high risk groups. Concepts.longName: Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index
Concepts.definition: A scoring system designed to classify a patient's risk of mantle cell lymphoma progression or relapse and overall survival following therapy. It uses the criteria of patient's age, ECOG performance status, serum LDH activity, WBC count and Ki-67 index to classify patients into low risk, medium risk or high risk groups. The MIPIb score is calculated using the formula: [0.03535 x age (years)] + 0.6978 (if ECOG > 1) + [1.367 x log10(LDH/ULN)] + [0.9393 x log10(WBC count)] + [0.02142 x Ki-67 (%)]. A score < 5.7 indicates low risk disease, 5.7 - 6.5 indicates intermediate risk, and 6.5 or greater high risk.

Property.preferredDefinition: The qualitative or quantitative estimation of the likelihood of adverse effects that may result from exposure to specified health hazards or from the absence of beneficial influences.

Concepts.definition: An estimated probability that one or more adverse event(s) will occur as a result of exposure to an actual or potential hazardous situation or chemical.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index Risk Assessment Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Low-Intermediate Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Low-Intermediate Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Low risk MIPI score (0-3) and Ki-67 greater than or equal to 30% or Intermediate risk MIPI score (4-5) and Ki-67 less than 30%. MIPI-c low-intermediate risk equals a MIPI-c score of 1.

Concepts.longName: Low-Intermediate Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index
Concepts.definition: Low risk MIPI score (0-3) and Ki-67 greater than or equal to 30% or Intermediate risk MIPI score (4-5) and Ki-67 less than 30%. MIPI-c low-intermediate risk equals a MIPI-c score of 1.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Low Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Low Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Low risk MIPI score (0-3) and Ki-67 less than 30%. Low risk MIPI-c equals a MIPI-c score of 0.

Concepts.longName: Low Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index
Concepts.definition: Low risk MIPI score (0-3) and Ki-67 less than 30%. Low risk MIPI-c equals a MIPI-c score of 0.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: High-Intermediate Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index

ValueMeaning.preferredName: High-Intermediate Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intermediate risk MIPI score (4-5) and Ki-67 greater than or equal to 30% or High risk MIPI score (6-11) and Ki-67 less than 30%. A MIPI-c high-intermediate risk equals a MIPI-c score of 2.

Concepts.longName: High-Intermediate Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index
Concepts.definition: Intermediate risk MIPI score (4-5) and Ki-67 greater than or equal to 30% or High risk MIPI score (6-11) and Ki-67 less than 30%. A MIPI-c high-intermediate risk equals a MIPI-c score of 2.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: High Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index

ValueMeaning.preferredName: High Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: High risk MIPI score (6-11) and Ki-67 greater than or equal to 30%. A MIPI-c high risk equals a MIPI-c score of 3.

Concepts.longName: High Risk Mantle Cell Lymphoma International Prognostic Index Combined Biologic Index
Concepts.definition: High risk MIPI score (6-11) and Ki-67 greater than or equal to 30%. A MIPI-c high risk equals a MIPI-c score of 3.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
